frameDefinitions: This frame describes an Agent's gathering of Individuals (people or entities) into a group, the  Aggregate, defined by relative proximity.
This frame covers entities which are prototypically conceived of and created to fulfill the function of containing--i.e.
An Agent or Cause places a Theme under a surface (often the ground) into a Goal location.
An Experiencer is involved in a bodily injury to a Body_part.
This frame concerns the movement of a Theme and an Agent and/or Carrier.
Generally without overall (translational) motion,  an Agent places a Theme at a location, the Goal, which is profiled.
frameExamples: The police <t>gathered</t> the suspects into a line-up.
The suspect <t>buried</t> his gun in the ground while fleeing the police.
I think that I <t>hurt</t> myself pretty bad back there.
Karl <t>carried</t> the books across campus to the library on his head.
David <t>placed</t> his briefcase on the floor.
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the aggregate that results from the gathering.  It may be expressed either as an adjunct result phrase or as a direct object of a target verb.
Agent is the person who gathers Individuals.
This role identifies the entities that come together to form an Aggregate.

This role identifies the time when the gathering event occurs, if specified.
The crowd assembled <fex name='Time'>at dawn</fex>.

This role identifies the place where the gathering event occurs.
He <t>assembled</t> the children <fex name='Place'>in the hall</fex>.
<fen>Container</fen> is an object which is conventionally used as a container.  Target words in this frame are tagged with this frame element.
The <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally buries the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that is buried.
The role <fen>Goal</fen> is the location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up.
A non-animate force which buries the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fen>Time</fen> is when the burying occurs
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the burying occurs.
The location on the body of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> where the bodily injury takes place.
The being or entity that is injured.
The time when the harming event occurs.
The place where the harming event occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is a sentient being who physically controls the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> via the carrier, accompanying the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fen>Goal</fen> identifies the endpoint of the path.
<fen>Source</fen> indicates the beginning of the path along which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels.
Path along which carrying occurs.
The objects being carried.
<fen>Area</fen> is used for descriprion of a general area in which the carrying action takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path.
The <fen>Carrier</fen> provides support for the <fen>Theme</fen>.  Movement of the <fen>Carrier</fen> results in movement of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The time in which the carrying event takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the general area that serves as a setting for the specific motion of the <fen>Agent</fen> and <fen>Theme</fen> (with <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, or <fen>Goal</fen>).
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person (or other force) that causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to move.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that changes location during the Placing.
The role <fen>Goal</fen> is the location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up. This role is profiled by words in this frame.
<fen>Time</fen> is when the Placing occurs
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the Placing occurs.
listRoleExamples: The police gathered the suspects <fex>into a line-up</fex>.
<fex>The police</fex> gathered the suspects into a lineup.
The police gathered <fex>the suspects</fex> into a line-up.
John carried a <fex><t>bucket</t></fex>.
<fex>The pirate</fex> placed the treasure on the island.
The pirate buried <fex>the gold</fex> under the tree.
The suspect buried the gun <fex>in the ground</fex>.
<fex>The tornado</fex> buried most of the structures in this area.
Smithers had buried the treasure there <fex>the night before</fex>.
It must have been buried <fex>south of this location</fex>, according to the map.
I cut <fex>my finger</fex> on the envelope.
<fex>The squirrel</fex> abraded <fex>its</fex> tail as it twitched nervously in the confined space.
So you cut your leg on the window frame <fex>at six o'clock</fex>, correct?
She fell and hit her head <fex>out in the playground</fex>.
<fex>Karl</fex> carried the books across the campus to the library.
Karl carried the books <fex>to the library</fex>.
Karl hauled the books <fex>from the library</fex>  to the office.
Karl carried the books <fex>across the campus</fex>.
Karl toted <fex>the books</fex> to the car.
<fex>The boat</fex> ferried the troops across the river.
<fex>Even in such a small port</fex>, these boats would transport many tons of trade-goods in to shore annually.
<fex>The waiter</fex> placed the food on the table.
The waiter placed <fex>the food</fex> on the table.
The waiter placed the food <fex>on the table</fex>.
Grass , which is sown with clover , provides rich pasture for cattle in summer and the clover is <fex>another plant which</fex> puts nitrogen into the soil .
Smithers had placed the table there <fex>the night before</fex>.
